english: mansion; tall building; large house; used in place names

etymology.description: semantic 广 + phonetic 夏 (phonetic also conveys 'great').
etymology.interpretation: 广 depicts a building/shelter, signaling the idea of a structure. 夏 supplies the sound xià, and since it can also mean “great,” it reinforces the sense of a large, imposing building such as a mansion.
etymology.simplification: In Simplified Chinese, the shelter component 广 was regularized to 厂 and the structure compressed, reducing strokes while retaining the phonetic 夏.

examples.chinese: 城市里到处是高楼大厦(城市裡到處是高樓大廈)。
examples.pinyin: Chéngshì lǐ dàochù shì gāolóu dàshà.
examples.english: There are tall buildings everywhere in the city.

examples.chinese: 这座大厦很气派(這座大廈很氣派)。
我们计划去厦门旅游(我們計畫去廈門旅遊)。
examples.english: We plan to travel to Xiamen.
